title: 2023-glbio
text:
Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. Explore Quarto’s formats, themes, and more here!


Quarto is language-agnostic: you can install it from the terminal, through RStudio, or VSCode. You can incorporate R/Py/Julia/Observable scripts seamlessly and weave them together into a single website, html_doc, dashboard, e-book, presentation, or publication of your choice!



File –> New File –> Quarto Document  Render and preview 
File –> New Project –> New Directory –> Quarto Project/Website  Use visual editor 
Learn more here using the Quarto Guide!

paged_table(ipr_combnd)



  







ipr_combnd %>%
  head |>
  kable(caption = "Table 1. Annotate with kableExtra") |>
  kable_styling(c("striped", "hover", "condensed"), full_width = F,
                position = "left") |>
  add_header_above(c("protein"=1, "domains" = 8)) |>
  column_spec(1, bold = T) |>
  row_spec(0, italic = T)

You can search, sort, and query the table interactively.




ipr_combnd |>
  head() |> 
  datatable(fillContainer=FALSE,
            options=list(pageLength=8))








You can now show/hide specific columns using the Column visibility button.

DT::datatable(ipr_combnd,
              extensions = c('Buttons', 'FixedColumns',
                             'RowReorder', 'RowGroup'),
              options = list(
                pageLength = 5,
                dom = 'Bfrtip',
                buttons = I('colvis'),
                buttons=list(list(extend = 'colvis', columns = c(5:9))),
                fixedColumns = list(leftColumns = 2),
                fixedHeader = TRUE,
                rowReorder = TRUE, order = list(c(0, 'asc')),
                scrollX = TRUE,
                rowGroup = list(dataSrc = 1),
                lengthMenu = c(10, 25, 100)
              ))
